member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeIpmt(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the interest payment for a period.
member.param: Delimited string containing the rate as percentage per period, the period, number of periods, present value, future value, and payment type (0 = end of period, 1 = start of period).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeIrr(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the internal rate of return of a series of cash flows.
member.param: Delimited string containing a range of cells and an initial guess.
member.returns: Internal rate of return.
member.remarks: This IRR calculation uses Newton's method to approximate a root of f(r) = Sum( values[i]/(1+r)^i) = 0 where the Sum index is i = 1 to the number of values. The algorithm returns a value if the relative difference between root approximations is less than 1e-5. It fails if this accuracy is not attained in 20 iterations.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeXirr(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the internal rate of return of a series of cash flows.
member.param: values, dates, guess. Values and dates are ranges of cells holding the values and dates. Guess is the initial guess. The first date is the the start date for the calculation.
member.returns: Internal rate of return.
member.remarks: This XIRR calculation is similar to IRR except that the values are not equally spaced in time. The algorithm returns a value if the relative difference between root approximations is less than 1e-5. It fails if this accuracy is not attained in 20 iterations.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeIspmt(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the simple interest payment.
member.param: Delimited string containing the rate as percentage per period, the period, number of periods, and present value.
member.returns: Interest payment.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeMirr(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the modified internal rate of return of a series of cash flows.
member.param: Delimited string containing a range of cells, finance interest rate, and a reinvest interest rate.
member.returns: Modified internal rate of return.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputePv(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the present value of an investment.
member.param: Delimited string containing the rate as percentage per period, number of periods, payment per period, future value, and payment type (0 = end of period, 1 = start of period).
member.returns: Present value.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeRate(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the internal rate of return of a series of cash flows.
member.param: Delimited string containing a range of cells and an initial guess.
member.returns: Internal rate of return.
member.remarks: This IRR calculation uses Newton's method to approximate a root of f(r) = Sum( values[i]/(1+r)^i) = 0 where the Sum index is i = 1 to the number of values. The algorithm returns a value if the relative difference between root approximations is less than 1e-7. It fails if this accuracy is not attained in 20 iterations.

member.returns: Depreciation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeOffSet(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a range that is the offset of the reference range by rows and cols.
member.returns: A range offset.
member.remarks: The returned range is the range passed in through the reference variable offset by the number of rows in the rows variable and number of columns in the cols variable. If height and width are present in the argument list, they determine the number of rows and columns in the returned range. Otherwise, the dimensions of the returned range match the input range.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ComputeMatch(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the index a specified value in a lookup_range.
member.returns: The relative index of the lookup_value in the lookup_range.
member.remarks: Lookup_range should be a either a single row range or a single column range. If match_type is 0, the relative index of the first exact match (ignoring case) in the specified range is returned. If match_type is 1, the values in the range should be in ascending order, and the index of the largest value less than or equal to the lookup_value is returned. If match_type is -1, the values in the range should be in descending order, and the index of the smallest value greater than or equal to the lookup_value is returned.

member.remarks: For example, =VLOOKUP("Axles",A1:C4,2,TRUE) looks for the exact match for Axles in A1:A4 and returns the corresponding value in B1:B4.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.FormulaContextCell
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell (in the column-row notation of A1 or E21) whose formula is being parsed or computed.
member.remarks: This property should be set only if you are directly parsing and computing formulas by calling the Parse or ComputedValue methods. In this case, you should set the property before calling either method. FormulaContextCell is used to provide support for CurrentRowNotation, circular calculation checks, and reference updating.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.SupportBlanksInSheetNames
member.summary: Gets or sets whether blanks are treated as significant in sheet names.
member.remarks: Earlier versions of GridFormulaEngine did not support the use of blanks in sheet names. (They were treated as insignificant.) The current version does treat blanks as significant. If you want to revert to the prior treatment of blanks in sheet names, then set this property to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.FixedReferenceOnlyOnPaste
member.summary: Determines whether fixed references should be adjusted on other than paste.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.DependentCells
member.summary: Contains a mapping between a cell and a list of formula cells that depend on it.
member.remarks: The key is the given cell, and the value is a Hashtable of cells containing formulas that reference this cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.DependentFormulaCells
member.summary: Contains a mapping between a formula cell and a list of cells upon which it depends.
member.remarks: The key is the given formula cell, and the value is a Hashtable of cells that this formula cell references.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.MaximumCircularChecks
member.summary: Gets / sets the number of recursive checks done for circular references.
member.remarks: When you edit a cell, the engine parsing will attempt to flag circular references as an error. This value sets the number of dependent cells it will check before assuming there is no circular reference. Checking every reference can be time consuming depending upon the formulas being used. This property lets you decide how many recursions the engine will allow when looking for circular references. The default value is -1 meaning no checks are done as you type formula into the cell. Setting this property to int.MaxValue will make the engine check all dependent cells for a circular reference.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.DoCircularCheckInValidating
member.summary: Gets or sets whether circular references should be checked in the CurrentCell.Validating event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.CloneableFormulaTags
member.summary: Gets / sets whether FormulaTags are cloned when setting one FormulaTag object equal to another.
member.remarks: This is by default set to False as normally the FormulaEngine expects to be working with referenced objects, and not clones of referenced objects.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.UsesVirtualDataSource
member.summary: Indicates whether the underlying data is virtually bound to the grid.
member.remarks: If the formula engine knows the data is stored within a GridControl.Data object, it can optimize data access. If the grid is being populated through virtual techniques (handling QueryCellInfo), the formula engine has to get the data through that means. The default value is to assume the data is coming from a virtual datasource. There are some other situations, like formulas in headers or frozen cells, when this property should be set to True.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.CalculatingSuspended
member.summary: Indicates whether formulas are immediately calculated as dependent cells are changed.
member.remarks: Use this property to suspend calculations while a series of changes are made to dependent cells either by the user or programmatically. When the changes are complete, set this property to False, and then call Engine.RecalculateRange to recalculate the affected range. See the sample in GridCellFormulaModel.CalculatingSuspended.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.MaximumRecursiveCalls
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of recursive calls that can be used to compute a cellvalue.
member.remarks: This property comes into play when you have a calculated formula cell that depends on another calculated formula that depends on another calculated formula and so on. If the 'depends on another formula' number exceeds MaximumRecursiveCalls, you will see a Too Complex message displayed in the cell. The default value is 100, but you can set it higher or lower depending upon your expected needs. The purpose of the limit is to avoid a circular reference locking up your application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.CurrentRowNotationEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disables using row = 0 in formulas to represent the current row.
member.remarks: When this property is set True, entering zero as a row in a formula is interpreted to be the current row. Using the current row notation allows you to sort a column in the grid and maintain the relative formula. After sorting, you do have to call engine.RecalculateRange to allow the relative formulas to reset themselves.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.UseDatesInCalculations
member.summary: Gets or sets whether dates can be used as operands in calculations. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.SuspendRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to suspend recalculation from occurring more than once on RecalculateRange call or any cell value change for better performance. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ForceParsingOfLibraryFunctionArguments
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all function arguments are parsed using GridFormulaEngine.Parse.
member.remarks: If you are using NamedRanges or CurrentRowNotationEnabled inside function arguments, you should set this property to true to make sure the proper substitutions are done on the arguments.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.NamedRanges

member.remarks: The key is the uppercase name and the value is the range for this name.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.NamedRangesOriginalNames
member.summary: Gets the named range Hashtable that holds the original case name as the value.
member.remarks: The key is the uppercase name and the value is the original name.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.NamedRangesSized
member.summary: Holds namedranges in order of string length.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.DependentNamedRangeCells
member.summary: Holds hashtables containing cells that depend upon namedranges.
member.remarks: The key properties in DependentNamedRangeCells are namedranges. The value properties are hashtables.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.LibraryFunctions
member.summary: Contains the current library functions.
member.remarks: This field gives you direct access to all Library Functions. The function name serves as the hash key, and the function delegate serves as the hash value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.UseCommonLibrary
member.summary: Gets or sets whether you want all grids to share the same collection of library functions.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.UseNoAmpersandQuotes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether strings concatenated using the ampersand operator should be returned inside double quote marks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.MaximumStackDepth
member.summary: Depth of the engine's calculation stack.
member.remarks: It is unlikely that you will need to adjust this value, as its default value of 100 is quite large. Any time a formula is to be computed, a Stack object is created with this number of elements to hold temporary calculations as the formula is being computed. For example, this formula: 1+1+1+...+1 requires a stack depth of 2 as there are only 2 temporary values needed as the formula is evaluated. However, this formula: 1+(1+(1+(1+1))) requires a depth of 5, as the five 1's are pushed onto the stack before the first addition (the right-most one) is performed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.FunctionEngineContext
member.summary: Gets the formula engine that holds the proper state information for LibraryFunction call.
member.remarks: If you are adding your own custom library functions and need to access GridFormulaEngine members like GetCellsFromArgs or GetValueFromArg from your code, then you should use this static property to retrieve the proper GridFormulaEngine object. This only matters if you are using multiple grids that you have registered using RegisterGridAsSheet, and are adding your own custom formulas. Note that GridFormulaEngine.FunctionEngineContext is only defined within the scope of a library function call, and will be null at all other times.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.ActiveFunctionName
member.summary: Returns the function name of the active function call. Empty if not in a call.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.AllowShortCircuitIFs
member.summary: Gets or sets whether IF function calculations should specifically avoid computing the non-used alternative.
member.remarks: The default value is false for code legacy consistency. When AllowShortCircuitIFs is set true, only the necessary alternative of an IF function is computed. To support this behavior, a change in how nested IF function calculations are done is necessary. The default way of calculating nested functions is inside-out, with the inner most functions being computed to a value before the next outer function is evaluated. To support short circuiting IF functions, nested IF functions need to be computed from the outside-in to know what alternative needs to be evaluated. This outside-in calculation pattern only applies to IF functions, and only when AllowShortCircuitIFs is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaEngine.EnsureIFCallDuringShortCircuit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the IF function implementation is called when is true. The default behavior is to not call the IF Function code in the library, but instead, work directly with the IF clauses.

member.remarks: This event may be raised more than once in the processing of a string into a formula.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridFormulaTag
member.summary: Support class that encapsulates the parsed formula and computed value for a cell.
member.remarks: This class holds the parsed value of the formula in its Formula property, and holds the computed value of the formula in its Text property. Each cell that is a formula cell stores a GridFormulaTag object in its GridStyleInfo.FormulaTag property. When the cell is drawn, if its GridFormulaTag.Formula property is empty, the formula in the GridStyleInfo.Text property is parsed, and placed into the GridFormulaTag.Formula property. If the GridFormulaTag.Text property is empty, the GridFormulaTag.Formula is computed, and the computed value is stored in GridFormulaTag.Text. Thus, formulas are parsed and computed only when the GridFormulaTag member is empty, otherwise, the stored values are used. Emptying these properties is how the Formula Engine initiates a refresh of the calculated values when dependent cells are modified.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoList.FilterRangeType(Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoType)
member.summary: Returns a range list with ranges that match a specified .
member.returns: A with ranges that match the above criteria.

members.member:
Creates a range list and convert column and row ranges into cell ranges with the specified bounds.
Row index for the first non-label cell in grid area. Column index for the first non-label cell in grid area. Last row in the grid. Last column in the grid The with new objects that this method creates. / Column ranges will be converted to cell ranges using nFirstRow and nRowCount. Row ranges will be converted to cell ranges using nFirstCol and nColCount. Column ranges will be converted to cell ranges using all input parameters.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoList.GetColRanges(Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoType)
member.summary: Creates a range list with column ranges that match a specified criteria.
member.returns: The range list with column ranges.
member.remarks:
Use
rangeList.GetColRanges(GridRangeInfoType.Cells|GridRangeInfoType.Cols);
if you want to get column ranges for both ranges that are cells or column ranges.
Use
rangeList.GetColRanges(GridRangeInfoType.Cols);
if you only want to get column ranges and not cell ranges.
Neighboring ranges will be combined if they intersect or have the same border (e.g. C4:C5 and C6:C7 will be combined into C4:C7).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoList.GetRowRanges(Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoType)
member.summary: Creates a range list with row ranges that match a specified criteria.
member.returns: The range list with row ranges.
member.remarks:
Use
rangeList.GetRowRanges(GridRangeInfoType.Cells|GridRangeInfoType.Rows);
if you want to get row ranges for both ranges that are cells or row ranges.
Use
rangeList.GetRowRanges(GridRangeInfoType.Rows);
if you only want to get row ranges and not cell ranges.
Neighboring ranges will be combined if they intersect or have the same border (e.g. R4:R5 and R6:R7 will be combined into R4:R7).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoList.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a range list from a string with comma separated range descriptions.
member.returns: The with range objects described in the string.
member.remarks: The method parses a string that was previously created with .

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInfoList.ToString

overload.para: Converts the ranges of this to a comma separated human-readable string.

summary.para: Converts the ranges of this to a comma separated human-readable string.

member.remarks:
The generate string will be in the format R#C#, R#, C#, T.
An example for a range of cells is "R1C1:R10C20" or "R5C5".
An example for a range of rows is "R1:R10" or "R6".
An example for a range of columns is "C1:C10" or "C7".
An example for a table range is "T".
Each range object will be comma separated. For example: "R3:R5,R8:R10,R14:R15".

returns.para: A string that contains the column and row index of the top-left and bottom-right position of this .

returns.para: A string that contains the column and row index of the top-left and bottom-right position of this .

member.summary: Do not set focus to text box.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridCellActivateAction.SetCurrent
member.summary: Begin editing / focus on text box whenever a cell becomes current cell no matter if user clicked on cell or moved with arrow keys.

When GridCellActivateAction.SetCurrent is specified will be called before the event is raised.
See the event if you want to programmatically call .
The cancelable event may block editing mode for the current cell.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridCellActivateAction.DblClickOnCell

member.summary: Provides data about the cancelable event before the grid activates the specified cell as current cell.
member.remarks:
You can disallow the activation of specific cells at run-time when you assign True to .
You can modify the and to activate a different cell.
You can determine if was called stand-alone or as result of a call by checking the property.
Once the current cell has been activated, a event is raised or a if activating the specified cell failed.
See for a discussion about the order of events that you receive when the current cell is moved.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridOleDropAtRowColEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs when the when the user releases the mouse over a cell at the end of an OLE drag-and-drop operation and before the data are applied to the grid.
member.remarks:
This event lets you provide your own customized paste data behavior.
If you do not wish the grid to proceed with default behavior for this method, set to True. The grid will check this flag to see whether it should proceed. If you set it to True, the calling method will check as indication if the operation was successful.
If you want the grid to proceed with default behavior, do not change .

member.remarks:
The event occurs when the user releases the mouse over a cell at the end of an OLE drag-and-drop operation and before the data is applied to the grid.
This event lets you provide your own customized paste data behavior.
If you do not wish the grid to proceed with default behavior for this method, set to True. The grid will check this flag to see whether it should proceed. If you set it to True, the calling method will check as indication if the operation was successful.
If you want the grid to proceed with default behavior, you should not change .

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridRangeInsertedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data about the and events.
member.remarks:
GridRangeInsertedEventArgs is a custom event argument class used by the and events.
This event is raised by the model to notify all associated views that it has inserted the specified number of rows or column into its data store and all associated views should redraw affected display contents.
The property indicates if all changes were successfully made to the model. If it is False, the operation was aborted. However, the view contents need to be redrawn no matter if the operation was successful or not.

member.summary: Provides data about the cancelable event.
member.remarks:
The GridSelectionChangingEventArgs is a custom event argument class used by the event when the model is in the process of selecting a range of cells as a result of a method call.
You can disallow the selection of specific cells at run-time when you assign true to .
You can also modify the to include additional cells.
The will raise a event before it updates its internal data structures and a event afterwards. A grid listens to this event and outlines the selected range of cells.

member.param: The range of cells to be selected.
The current state of the user action and reason for this event (mouse, keyboard or programmatic).

The range of cells to be selected when the previous range is reset.
Will be set only if reason is GridSelectionReason.SetCurrentCell, GridSelectionReason.MouseDown, GridSelectionReason.MouseMove.

member.remarks: True, if current cell is at the topmost nonfrozen row, scroll the view. False, move current cell into frozen cells. If current cell is at the top row, scroll the view.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridQueryCellModelEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that handles a event.
member.param: A that contains the event data.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridQueryCellModelEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data about the event.
member.remarks:
The GridQueryCellModelEventArgs is a custom event argument class used by the event for querying the based on a string cellType.
The GridModel has a table with all cell types used in the grid. Whenever the grid encounters a new cell type that it cannot find in the table, it will raise a event. The identifies the name of the cell type. The should receive the new instance of the associated cell object. This object will be stored in the table together with its name and reused among cells with the same .
You should process this event if you want to add custom cell types and initialize these cell types on demand when associated cells are accessed the first time.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridQueryCellModelEventArgs.#ctor(Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridModel,System.String)
member.summary: Initalizes a new object.
member.param: The cell type identifier as used in the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridQueryCellModelEventArgs.CellType
member.summary: The cell type identifier as used in the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridQueryCellModelEventArgs.CellModel
member.summary: The for the cell type. You should create a new instance of the specific cell model and save it to this property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridDateTimeEditStyleInfo
member.summary:
Provides a object for date time edit control properties in a cell.
Each property in this sub object can be configured individually. Properties that have not been initialized will inherit default values from a base style.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridBaseStyle
member.summary: GridBaseStyle represents base styles in the grid. A base style has a name and holds the object with style information. Cells in the grid can reference a base style with .
member.remarks:
The grid has four system-defined base styles:
NameDescriptions
StandardHolds cell information for all cells.
HeaderHolds cell information for row and column headers.
Row HeaderHolds cell information specific to row headers.
Column HeaderHolds cell information specific to column headers.
You can format each cell in the grid individually, but settings that have not been initialized will be inherited from a base style whereas the standard style is the style that any cell will inherit information from.
You can register custom base styles with the map that you can access with .
Base styles themselves can be inherited from other base styles. The "Row Header" base style is derived from the "Header" base style for example.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridBaseStylesMap
member.summary: GridBaseStylesMap holds a collection of base styles for a grid and lets you add, remove, and change base styles.
member.remarks:
A base style has a name and holds the object with style information. Cells in the grid can reference a base style with .
The grid has four system-defined base styles as discussed in overview. The method adds these system styles to the collection.
You can register custom base styles with the map that you can access with .
Use to let users customize base styles at run-time.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridCellSpanBackgroundInfoCollection
member.summary:
A collection with elements derived from type . Internally this collection maintains both a List of CellSpanBackgroundInfo and a so called pool. The pool allows immediate lookup of cell spans given a cells row and column index. The list allows looping through cell spans in the order they were added.
CellOverlappSpanInfoCollection is similar to but with the difference that it allows overlaps between cell spans. If a cell has an overlap and is called for this cell all cell spans will be returned in a list that contain the specified cell.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridCoveredCellInfoCollection
member.summary: A collection with elements derived from type . It implements . Internally this collection maintains both a List of CoveredCellInfo and a so called pool. The pool allows immediate lookup of cell spans given a cells row and column index. The list allows looping through cell spans in the order they were added. GridCoveredCellInfoCollection assumes that there is no overlap between cell spans. For any given cell there only at most one cell span must exist.

member.summary: Gets a covered cell from the that includes the specified cells row and column index or if there is no covered range for the cell the method returns a cell range for the given row and column index.
member.param: The resulting covered range. If there is no covered range for the cell this range will return GridRangeInfo.Cell(rowIndex, columnIndex)

member.summary: Represents the method that handles a event which can be marked as handled.
member.param: A that contains the event data.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridQueryCoveredRangeEventArgs
member.summary:
GridQueryCoveredRangeEventArgs is a custom event argument class used by the event to query information about covered cells at a specified cell.
This event allows you to specify covered ranges at run-time, e.g when you have a large grid with repeating patterns of covered ranges. If the specified row and column index is part of a covered cell's range, you should assign the coordinates of the covered cell to and set to True.
indicates that you supplied data from your event handler and no further querying for data about covered range information for this cell is necessary.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridCurrentCell.QueryNextEnabledCell(Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Grid.GridDirectionType,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines the next enabled cell when current cell wants to move into a given direction. Cells that are not marked as enabled with will be skipped. The search in a given direction is aborted when the row or column index hits the boundaries of the range.
member.param: The that specifies the direction of the current cell movement.
member.returns: True if an enabled cell was found; False otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method will not raise the event. Instead you can call this method from your QueryNextMoveCell event handler to find out about the next enabled cell and then decide on further criteria if the suggested cell is good.
You should call instead if you want the event to be raised.

Each property in this sub object can be configured individually. Properties that have not been initialized will inherit default values from a base style.

members.member:
Gets or sets the String validation.
If you set this as StringValidation.OnKeyPress then control will handle the validation part. if it is set to StringValidation.OnLostFocus then you can handle the vaidation in the CurrentCellValidating event. The min validation.

The of the class will return the validation info that this method generates through its overriden version of .
Default settings are:
PropertyValue

'.'
String.Empty
':'
